overview.description: Sikkim, located in northeastern India, is known for its Himalayan landscapes, monasteries, and biodiversity. Established as a state on May 16, 1975, it features attractions like Gangtok and Pelling.

top_destinations.name: Gangtok
top_destinations.description: The capital with Enchey Monastery and MG Marg.
top_destinations.best_time: March to May, October to December
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit monasteries; shop at MG Marg.

top_destinations.name: Pelling
top_destinations.description: Known for Pemayangtse Monastery and Kanchenjunga views.
top_destinations.best_time: March to June, October to December
top_destinations.travel_tips: Trek to Khecheopalri Lake; carry warm clothes.

top_destinations.name: Nathula Pass
top_destinations.description: A high-altitude pass near the Indo-China border.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Guru Kinley
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and local fusion.

must_visit_spots.name: Enchey Monastery
must_visit_spots.description: A serene Buddhist monastery in Gangtok.

must_visit_spots.name: Tsomgo Lake
must_visit_spots.description: A glacial lake with stunning views.

must_visit_spots.name: Rumtek Monastery
must_visit_spots.description: A major Buddhist site near Gangtok.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Gangtok is 120 km from Siliguri (NH10, 4-5 hrs). By train: Nearest railhead New Jalpaiguri (125 km). By air: Bagdogra Airport.
travel_essentials.best_time: March to May, October to December
travel_essentials.tips: Carry warm clothing; obtain permits for restricted areas.
